question: [File: aptos-core/ecosystem/node-checker/src/checker/tps.rs] [Function: check()] [Sensitive data in error messages] Error messages include full error chains with {:#} - can this log sensitive information like private keys, API tokens, or internal configurations? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/ecosystem/node-checker/src/checker/tps.rs] [Function: check()] [Result description manipulation] CheckResult descriptions include rate values - can extremely long or malicious strings in these descriptions cause log injection or log file exhaustion? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/ecosystem/node-checker/src/checker/tps.rs] [Enum: TpsCheckerError] [Error message side channels] Error messages reveal internal state (submitted TPS vs minimum) - can attackers use error messages to infer checker configuration or system state? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/ecosystem/node-checker/src/checker/tps.rs] [Constant: NODE_REQUIREMENTS_LINK] [Link manipulation] The constant links to external documentation - if this URL is compromised, can attackers redirect failed node operators to malicious sites? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/ecosystem/node-checker/src/checker/tps.rs] [Function: check()] [Committed vs submitted inequality] The check allows rate.committed < rate.submitted as passing if committed meets minimum - can this mask nodes that accept but fail to execute transactions? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/ecosystem/node-checker/src/checker/tps.rs] [Function: check()] [InsufficientSubmittedTransactionsError timing] This error is returned before checking rate.committed - can this cause false negatives where the node could have met committed TPS but the check failed early? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/ecosystem/node-checker/src/checker/tps.rs] [Function: check()] [BuildClusterError non-retryable] Cluster building errors are marked non-retryable - can transient DNS or network issues cause permanent failures for legitimate nodes? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/ecosystem/node-checker/src/checker/tps.rs] [Function: check()] [TransactionEmitterError retryable] Transaction emitter errors are marked retryable - can this cause infinite retry loops if the error is persistent but transient-looking? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/ecosystem/node-checker/src/checker/tps.rs] [Function: check()] [Evaluation result array single element] The function always returns vec![single_result] - can calling code that expects multiple results have off-by-one errors or incorrect aggregation logic? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/ecosystem/node-checker/src/checker/tps.rs] [Struct: TpsCheckerConfig] [CommonCheckerConfig inheritance] The common field is flattened - can security-critical settings in CommonCheckerConfig be overridden by TpsCheckerConfig fields? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/ecosystem/node-checker/src/checker/tps.rs] [Function: check()] [API provider client.build_path] The build_path('/') is called on the client - can path traversal or injection in the base URL cause unintended API endpoints to be called? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/ecosystem/node-checker/src/checker/tps.rs] [Function: check()] [ChainId::new validation] ChainId::new() takes response.chain_id without validating it's in a valid range - can out-of-range values cause issues in downstream chain ID comparisons? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/ecosystem/node-checker/src/checker/tps.rs] [Function: check()] [Cluster emission transaction count] The total number of transactions emitted isn't explicitly bounded - can extremely long-running TPS tests emit millions of transactions causing storage exhaustion? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/ecosystem/node-checker/src/checker/tps.rs] [Function: check()] [Perfect transaction execution assumption] When stats.committed == stats.submitted, code assumes node could go higher - can this hide issues where the node is at maximum capacity? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/ecosystem/node-checker/src/checker/tps.rs] [Function: check()] [Score value semantics] Using score 100 for pass and 0 for fail - is there any middle ground, or can nodes that barely pass get the same score as high-performing nodes? (Low)
